resources.name: crop_data

fields.name: harvest_year
fields.title: Year in which crop harvested
fields.description: Year in which the crop was harvested. Years when no yields were recorded are not included (1940-1948).

fields.name: crop
fields.title: Crop type grown
fields.description: Name of crop grown in this harvest year

fields.name: plot
fields.title: Plot number
fields.description: Plot number since 1876, 1-10.

fields.name: previous_fertilizer_code
fields.title: Previous fertilizer and manure treatment code 1876-1901
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer or manure applied to that plot, 1876-1901.

fields.name: current_year_fertilizer_code
fields.title: Current year fertilizer treatment code
fields.description: Code describing the fertilizer applied in this harvest year. N indicates basal fertilizer N applied, nil indicates no fertilizer or manure applied

fields.name: n_fertilizer_amount
fields.title: Fertilizer N amount
fields.description: Total inorganic nitrogen fertilizer applied to this plot in this harvest year. Fertilizer N not applied in fallow years. No other fertilizer or manure applied in this period. Fertilizer N applied to all plots; it is not a treatment factor

fields.name: n_fertilizer_type
fields.title: Type of fertilizer N
fields.description: Chemical form of the nitrogen fertilizer applied in this harvest year.

fields.name: chalk_amount
fields.title: Chalk amount
fields.description: In the winters of 1954-55 and 1959-60 calcium carbonate was applied as ground chalk to parts of some of the plots, to ensure soil pH was around 7-8. See notes for full details

fields.name: sowing_date
fields.title: Sowing date
fields.description: Date the crop was sown.

fields.name: harvest_date
fields.title: Harvest date
fields.description: Date the crop was harvested.

fields.name: variety
fields.title: Variety
fields.description: Crop variety or cultivar.

fields.name: plot_area
fields.title: Plot area
fields.description: Plot area.

fields.name: grain_yield
fields.title: Grain yield
fields.description: Harvested barley grain yield at 85% dry matter.

fields.name: straw_yield
fields.title: Straw yield
fields.description: Harvested barley straw yield at 85% dry matter. This does not include stubble.

fields.name: note_id
fields.title: Note identification
fields.description: Note number

resources.title: crop yield data
resources.description: The main data table containing annual yield data for all plots 1949-1975, with agronomic details including sowing dates and varieties. No yields were recorded 1940-1948. Basal nitrogen fertilizer was applied to all plots in 1940-1974; no other fertilizer or manure was applied. The experiment tests the residual effects of different fertilizers and manures applied in 1856-1901. Ground chalk was applied as required to parts of some plots in 1954-55 and 1959-60 to ensure soil pH was around pH 7-8.  Spring barley was grown every year except 1967 and 1975 (bare fallow). In 1957 and 1958 some plots were used for microplot experiments, that data is not included here. Grain and straw yields are at 85% dry matter.  See notes and plans for further details.

fields.description: Latin botanical name of crop type

fields.description: A controlled vocabulary URI for the treatment factor level form

resources.title: Crop types
resources.description: List of crops grown with Latin names and AGROVOC concepts.

resources.title: Notes
resources.description: Additional explanatory notes for records in the crop_data table

name: exhaustion-land-experiment-annual-crop-yields-1940-75
title: Exhaustion Land Experiment annual crop yields 1940-75
description:
### Abstract
This dataset contains annual spring barley yield data for all plots of the Exhaustion Land Experiment, 1949-1975, and agronomic details including sowing dates and varieties. No yields were recorded 1940-1948.  Basal nitrogen fertilizer was applied to all plots 1940-1974; no other fertilizer or manure was applied. This phase of the experiment tests the residual effects of different fertilizers and manures applied 1856-1901.
### Methods
The experiment was established in 1856 and divided into 10 plots (1-10) in 1876, each receiving a different fertilizer or manure treatment until 1901. No fertilizer or manure was applied 1902-1939. Spring barley was grown every year from 1949 except 1967 and 1975 (bare fallow). In 1957 and 1958 some plots were used for microplot experiments; this data is not included here.
### Technical Info
Barley grain and straw yields at 85% dry matter, the straw yields do not include stubble. Ground chalk was applied as required to parts of some plots in 1954 and 1960 to ensure soil was around pH 7-8.
### Provenance
Individual plot yields were taken from Rothamsted Experimental Station Annual Reports and Yield Books.  Agronomic information (sowing dates, variety, etc) taken from Annual Reports, Yield Books, plans and descriptions in the Rothamsted Library archives. The frictionless dataset of combined yields and treatment data was compiled by June Kimori and checked by Daniel Philcox and Margaret Glendining, July 2022.
### Quality
In accordance with the Joint Code of Practice for Research at Rothamsted, data processing in e-RA follow rigorous standard operating procedures to ensure the quality and correctness of data collected in the field through to depositing in the e-RA database. To ensure quality control during data inputting, the data sets were typed on two separate occasions (double data entry). During the second typing (verification) the data values were compared with those typed on the earlier occasion, and any discrepancies were resolved before verification continued. This procedure avoided visual checking of data, which can be very inaccurate.
